item.title: About sammler.io
item.description: Introduction sammler is my very personal attempt to bring business life, social activities and IoT together. I am fully adopting cloud computing as consumer and producer, but I hate it, that I don’t have all the data available at a fingertip - just to be able to analyze them. Furthermore I am fully adopting IoT, collecting already more than 1GB each week. So I need a solution to constantly collect and analyze all the data, their correlation, just to get interesting insights.

item.title: Principles
item.description: While working on sammler I have defined some principles, I try to follow: Everything is open sourced. Follow a Readme Driven Development. Publish everything: my progress, failure, thoughts, decisions. (Will be fun in a year from now to especially read all the silly decisions ;-)) Use as much existing solutions as possible, focus on assembling, rather than writing new code. All activities should be continuously tested and deployed to the cloud.

item.title: Technology Choices
item.description: Some opinionated assumptions and technology choices have been made. But this might change over time. Programming/scripting languages: JavaScript / TypeScript, GoLang UI framework: Angular + TypeScript CSS framework: Clarity Storage: MongoDB Messaging: RabbitMQ Containerization: Docker Service orchestration: Docker Swarm, Kubernetes Deployment: Packer, Terraform, Vagrant All other decisions will be documented over time.

item.title: Roadmap
item.description: I have spent most of 2017 to get some of the basics done for sammler (and basically learn, learn & learn). Now it’s time to bring everything together. Therefore phases have been defined for the next development steps. Phase 1: Core Have some scheduled tasks defined (file based, just a YML file) (=jobs) in the scheduler-service Run those scheduled tasks, publishing messages to RabbitMQ Periodically listening to the tasks and executing (heartbeat-service) Writing the results to a log-service (strategy-heartbeat) Show the results of the log-service in a UI heartbeat-service-ui Log both locally or using a LaaS provider Show the log results in some basic UI Phase 2: Runnable Stack scheduler-service with predefined jobs (.

item.title: FAQ
item.description: What does sammler mean? sammler is the german word for collector, gatherer, assembler or collecting agent. How is the name written? sammler, not Sammler. What’s s5r ? s5r is just the abbreviation for sammler, just being lazy and because it looks cool and unique ;-)
